alert.note: Alert for Coke; Irion; Nolan; Sterling; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 8:39PM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Coke, Sterling, southwestern Nolan, northwestern Tom Green and northwestern Irion Counties through 930 PM CST... At 839 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles northwest of Sterling City to 20 miles north of Barnhart. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Robert Lee, Sterling City, Carlsbad, Maryneal, Silver, Broome, Sanco, E.V. Spence Reservoir Near Paint Creek Recreation Area, Water Valley, The Intersection Of Highway 158 And Ranch Road 2059 and Us- 87 Near The Coke-Tom Green County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Coke; Irion; Nolan; Sterling; Tom Green
